item.title: The American Style of quotation mark punctuation makes no sense
item.description: Years ago, I translated an excellent essay by Terry Windling, On Tolkien and Fairie-Stories, from American English to Italian. I remember arguing with the author about her use of periods in quotations. Every quote in her text had a period right before the closing mark. I wrote to her about that. I was perplexed. We don’t do that in Italy, I wrote. She insisted that her style was correct. From her perspective, she was correct.
